conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on each object and determine the equilibrium state of the system.
Object A is connected to object B via a spring and to object C via a rope passing over a pulley.
Object B is on the ground and connected to object A by a spring.
Object C is connected to object A by a rope passing over a pulley.
Objects A, B, and C are all in a state of rest initially.
Gravitational acceleration is g, and all friction is neglected.
Change the mass of object C to 5m, causing C to slowly descend.
The system reaches a new equilibrium state with B still on the ground.
C is only subjected to gravity and the tension of the rope.
Identify forces: Object A has spring tension and rope pulling; Object B has rope pulling; Object C has rope tension.
Equilibrium state: Net force on each object is zero.
Net force on object A is tension in spring minus weight of A.
Net force on object B is tension in rope minus weight of B.
Net force on object C is tension in rope minus weight of C.
Calculate tension in spring: T = kx, displacement x = 2m/k, so T = 2m.
Calculate tension in rope: T = mg.
Net force on object A is 2m - mg.
Net force on object B is mg - 2m.
Net force on object C is mg - mg = 0.
Calculate height object A rises: difference in vertical displacement of A and B.
Vertical displacement of object A is 2m/k.
Vertical displacement of object B is 3m/k.
Height object A rises is 2m/k - 3m/k = -1m/k.
The height that object A rises during this process is -1m/k.
